name: The Repose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jan and Rachid are amazing! First, I accidentally booked the wrong night and they helped us correct it from the US before we got there. Next, we got stuck at the airport in Casablanca and they helped us every step of the way to Rabat. When we arrived at the train station they sent a taxi for us.
reviews.title: A jewel off the beaten path...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: After a very long journey we were greeted with hot tea and cookies. Jan then cooked a wonderful traditional Moroccan dinner. Unfortantely we missed our breakfast because we woke up late for our appointment but Jan offered to keep it warm for us.
reviews.title: gorgeous riad with wonderful owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Because we were there for an event that required us to be in Rabat and then another part of Morocco the next day, we only stayed one night and two days. We would have loved to stay for a vacation or extended period of time. It is a tiny gem in the heart of Rabat.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Repose is a beautiful riad, hidden in Sale, across the river from Rabat. Although I did not stay there, I took a cooking class there. Jan and Rachid and everyone there are extremely nice and generous. They organized a private cooking class for me. I got there, they gave me tea and cookies in the beautiful sitting room. I got a tour of the riad, of all the rooms, and it is so beautiful. The rooms are gorgeous. They also serve dinner there. Next time I am in Rabat or Sale I will definitely stay there. I would definitely recommend this riad for everyone.
reviews.title: Nothing is too much trouble

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jan and Rachid are truly wonderful hosts - they will bend over backwards to accommodate every question and request and are lovely company. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful, with carved wooden doors, feature mosaics and stunning decor throughout. The roof terrace is a dream too. Sale is a tiny bit out of the way for business trips since most businesses are on the other side of the river but it's the most minor quibble in what is essentially a hidden gem. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: The Respose lives up to its name as a luxury riad (plus some)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here in October. The Riad is compact but beautifully formed and there is great attention to detail e.g. the beds and linen were great (always something that concerns me when away from ones own!). The roof terrace was a lovely, relaxing place and great for breakfast. In my opinion the mint tea and breakfasts were the best we had in Morocco. Jan and Rachid offer so much in the way of phones, maps and advice that it made our visit such smooth going and set us up for the rest of our holiday. We found wandering around Sale and it's souqs to be a lovely authentic experience and we also loved Rabat's main souq - the nicest shopping experience we had in Morocco. This Riad is a great place to chill after a busy day and as it's fairly small and owners chatty and live on site we talked a lot to them and other guests, which was great. A general point - if you like a lot of privacy you should know Riads have windows facing out into the internal courtyard/walkways and only some onto the Medina so sounds can carry more and you don't get a lot of natural light in rooms (but that's what roof terraces are for)
reviews.title: Lovely traditional Riad and great hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This is a beautiful, romantic riad in the heart of the old medina of Sale, which is the town just across the river from Rabat. The romantic aspect was somewhat wasted on me as a solo business traveller - the heart-shaped pot-pourri display on the bedspread was a nice touch though!
reviews.title: A beautiful riad...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The welcome was friendly, the rooms and public areas were beautiful, and the food hearty and delicious. (there's not much in the way of restaurants in Sale so if you don't eat in the hotel it's local street food which is a slightly different experience :-)
reviews.title: This Riad was a great introduction for our first trip to Morrocco

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time of booking I was given helpful, fast advice by e-mail as to the best way to arrive - and the hotel arranges efficient transfers to and from the station and anywhere else you might need to go, and for work purposes there's fast wifi.
reviews.title: A wonderful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only small negative point was the slightly erratic hot water in the shower in the morning, but this was being worked on while I was there so I'm sure was a temporary issue.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had an absolutely lovely 3 days at the Riad Repose over new year 2010-11. It was our first stop in a two week trip through Morocco, and as far as accommodation goes it was my favourite place. Jan and Rachid were fabulous hosts, and the rooms were fabulous, and I loved the breakfasts. I would give it 5/5 but due to a slight mix up with our reservation, we didn't get the room we wanted for the first night, so had to change rooms, which is always a bit of a pain when you just want to relax and unpack for a few days (we didn't have many days on our trip that we could do that, so it would have been nice). But on the flip side, we got to stay in another room which was quite nice too. The only other thing that was annoying was that we couldn't pay by visa, which we didn't know until we went to check out. That was a significant amount to have to pay when we had budgeted it as a visa spend, so again, slightly inconvenient. But minor inconveniences aside, I'd highly recommend this riad, and would very gladly stay there again.
reviews.title: Really loved it, and would love to give it 5/5

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I chose this Riad because of its rating on this website and could not have been happier with my choice. I needed to stay for two nights on a business trip and had never been to Morocco before. Jan and Rachid could not have been more helpful, including arranging taxis to/from the station and to my appointment out of town and even getting my return train ticket to Casablanca in advance in case there was a queue when I got to the station.
reviews.title: It deserves its no 1 rating on Trip Advisor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were very comfortable, the breakfasts and dinner on one night were fine. There are not many places to eat in Salé but Jan suggested I went to the Marina, about 15 minutes away through the town centre, where there was a good selection of modern restaurants, mainly European dishes.
reviews.title: A relaxing stay with not a tajine in sight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although Salé is on the other side of the river to the sights of Rabat, it took less than 30 minutes to walk there, either across the bridge by the Marina or on the small rowing boats across the river by the beach.
reviews.title: Jan and Rachid are consummate hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: After 10 days in Morocco, for us the best thing about staying here was eating dinner in the evenings (set menu for additional 200 dirhams per person). Every night we enjoyed varied and interesting courses, and always left the table struggling to finish. Rooms have been tastefully decorated and both the owners and staff were super. The medina in Sale is a great place to wander about to see the locals in action, whilst the Rabat medina is a great no-hassle place to do your shopping.
reviews.title: Total gem in Sale medina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jan and Rachid made us feel right at home in their beautifully renovated riad. As soon as we arrived they welcomed us with mint tea and cookies while our bags were brought to our room. We stayed in the Chefchaouin room which was beautiful. Only complaint was that this room was facing the street and was a bit noisy at times (but this is a pedestrian street so things quieted down by 11 pm). We chose to eat all of our dinners at the riad because the food was amazing (vegetarian) and there weren't very many restaurants near by as this riad is in Sale which is a bit less touristy (this was a plus for us). However, it would be easy to take a quick taxi to Rabat to have supper if one wanted.
reviews.title: A warm and beautiful riad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: The first night's dinner they had live traditional gnawa music playing while we ate - great atmosphere!
reviews.title: Just like being at home only better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: We took advantage of some of the other services they offered such as getting henna done and getting massages in our room which were both great.
reviews.title: Exceedingly friendly and welcoming, beautiful decor, delightful place to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts and the service here were also great.
reviews.title: hard to beat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: We would highly recommend this place if you are planning a trip to Rabat/Sale.
reviews.title: Breathtakingly Fabulous! In Awe of the Tasteful Decor!!

description: Lovingly restored by the owners, Rachid and Jan, this luxury riad has been renovated and decorated using traditional materials and craftsmanship to give a haven of peace and tranquility. The whole riad oozes Moroccan charm and each of the 4 suites has its own unique identity. The salon is ideal for dining in the cooler months, reading a book or playing games. The courtyard is great for sipping tea, listening to the splashes of the fountain, while the terrace is fabulous for breakfast, sunbathing or siestas in the shade. With Rachid and Jan living on-site, the hospitality and customer service are second-to-none and the combination of their local knowledge and awareness of international expectations ensures a warm and comfortable stay.
